BodyName: Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6626, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8323, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year two thousand eighteen”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the FY'18”. (S.6626 / A.8323)

Items.Title: AND SUCH OTHER BUSINESS AS MAY BE NECESSARY

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5706, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7603, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing awards to spouses of emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians who are killed while engaged in the discharge of duty”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Providing awards to spouses of emergency medical technicians and advanced emergency medical technicians who are killed while engaged in the discharge of duty”. (S.5706 / A.7603)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5484-A, and Assembly Member DenDekker, A.7185-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the general municipal law, in relation to pension benefits of widows or widowers of sanitation workers”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Pension benefits of widows or widowers of sanitation workers”. (S.5484-A / A.7185-A)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Peralta, S.6703, and Assembly Member Aubry, A.8305-A, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue certain parkland for the purpose of construction and operation of a pre-kindergarten center with a focus on instruction in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the city of NY to discontinue certain parkland for the purpose of construction and operation of a pre-kindergarten center with a focus on instruction in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics”. (A.8305-A/S.6703)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Serrano, S.6724, and Assembly Member Joyner, A.8422, “AN ACT to authorize the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of Corporal Fischer Park in the borough of the Bronx and to sell and convey such land upon terms and conditions to  facilitate the construction of affordable housing ”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Authorize NYC to discontinue the use as parkland of a portion of Corporal Fisher Park in the borough of the Bronx and to sell and convey such land upon terms and conditions to facilitate the construction of affordable housing. (S.6724/ A.8422)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Serrano, S.6721, and Assembly Member Benedetto, A.8419, “AN ACT in relation to authorizing discontinuance of the use as parkland of land in the city of New York commonly known as the Marx Brothers playground ”.
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Authorizing discontinuance of the use as parkland of land in the city of New York commonly known as Marx Brothers playground.  (A.8419/S.6721)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6626, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8323, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year two thousand eighteen”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the FY'18”. (S.6626 / A.8323)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million people or more a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school zones by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and  the  general municipal  law relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New  York, in relation to making technical corrections thereto”.  (S.6046-B/A.7798-B)
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York (S.6046-B and A.7798-B)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic law and the public officers law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million people or more a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school zones by means of photo devices, in relation to the effectiveness thereof; and to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014, amending the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and  the  general municipal  law relating to photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New  York, in relation to making technical corrections thereto”.  (S.6046-B/A.7798-B)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be P-C Item Approved by Comm approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York (S.6046-B and A.7798-B)
